answers.author: Allen Rothermel
answers.text:
Alex
The City of Delaware, OH constructed a 13,000 sq. ft multi-use (boards, boots, bikes) facility in 2006.  Original plans were prepared by Team Pain, however, due to financial constraints a revised plan was prepared by The Blue Stone Group (Columbus, OH) and approved by City Council for $500,000.  The revision involved replacing a large spine ramp with an 8 ft. deep kidney shaped bowl. Background info and pics are attached.  The facility has been a home run for the city attracting skaters from all over the country at beginning to advanced skill levels.  Bikers, in-line and boarders share the use equally.  The metal coping on all edges has been the key to a multi-use facility.  Upkeep and maintenance has been minimal and the facility is still in good condition.
Allen Rothermel
Assistant City Manager
Delaware, OH
740-203-1802

author: Alex Carmichael
text:
Hello All,
My department is considering the feasibility of a combined BMX/Skate Park, and I am looking to see if anyone has experience with this kind of dual purpose facility. Specifically, I am looking for design and policy examples. Can any of you share any information that could be helpful? 
Cordially, 
Alex Carmichael, MPA
title: BMX/Skate Park
